data.title: Crytek Agrees Deal with SEGA and Creative Assembly for the Acquisition of Crytek Black Sea
data.meta_description: Crytek’s former studio in Bulgaria becomes Creative Assembly Sofia
data.text: Crytek’s Managing Director, Avni Yerli, said: “In the past few weeks, we have worked closely with Creative Assembly and the team in Sofia to ensure that the talented staff at Crytek Black Sea would be well taken care of. We are delighted to be able to announce that SEGA’s acquisition of Crytek Black Sea has been finalized along with the studio’s transition from Crytek to Creative Assembly. This change is a part of the essential steps we are taking to re-focus on our core competencies and ensure Crytek is a healthy and sustainable business moving forward. We would like to thank the Sofia team for their passion and dedication and are looking forward to seeing them do great things as part of Creative Assembly.”
